items.synopsis: Hamas's tunnels under Gaza are a prime target for Israel as it expands its ground offensive in the north of the enclave after three weeks of aerial bombardment.

title.children: Ground-level clashes intensify as Israeli military confirms deadly strikes on Gaza refugee camp

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Video shows debris, craters and ruined buildings at the Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza on Tuesday after the area was hit by Israeli air strikes. An Israeli army spokesperson confirmed the attack to CNN, saying a senior Hamas commander had been in the area. Palestinian health officials said at least 50 people were killed when Israeli air strikes hit the densely populated refugee camp.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Video shows aftermath of air strikes on Jabalia refugee camp

children.content: Video shows debris, craters and ruined buildings at the Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza on Tuesday after the area was hit by Israeli air strikes.
An Israeli army spokesperson confirmed the attack to CNN, saying a senior Hamas commander had been in the area.
Palestinian health officials said at least 50 people were killed when Israeli air strikes hit the densely populated refugee camp.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: In an update, Israel's military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari confirmed Tuesday's air strikes on Jabalia refugee camp and said it targeted a "central Hamas stronghold". Officials at Gaza's Indonesian Hospital said more than 50 Palestinians had been killed and 150 wounded when tons of aerial explosives struck residential dwellings in the heart of the Jabalia camp in urbanised north Gaza. "During the afternoon hours, infantry and armored forces secured a central Hamas stronghold in the west part of Jabalia," Hagari said. "This stronghold served as a training center for the October 7th massacre and as a passage to the coastline from where additional terrorists set off to perpetrate the October 7th massacre. "In the course of the fighting, we eliminated many terrorists and destroyed terror infrastructure. "This is complicated combat, some of which is face-to-face combat. During the combat, we lost soldiers." The Israel military has accused Hamas, which rules the narrow coastal territory, of using civilian buildings as cover for fighters, commanders and weaponry, accusations it denies. Jabalia houses families of refugees from wars with Israel dating back to 1948. Reporting with Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel says it 'secured a central Hamas stronghold' in Gaza refugee camp air strikes

children.content: In an update, Israel's military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari confirmed Tuesday's air strikes on Jabalia refugee camp and said it targeted a "central Hamas stronghold".

Officials at Gaza's Indonesian Hospital said more than 50 Palestinians had been killed and 150 wounded when tons of aerial explosives struck residential dwellings in the heart of the Jabalia camp in urbanised north Gaza.
"During the afternoon hours, infantry and armored forces secured a central Hamas stronghold in the west part of Jabalia," Hagari said.
"This stronghold served as a training center for the October 7th massacre and as a passage to the coastline from where additional terrorists set off to perpetrate the October 7th massacre.
"In the course of the fighting, we eliminated many terrorists and destroyed terror infrastructure.
"This is complicated combat, some of which is face-to-face combat. During the combat, we lost soldiers."
The Israel military has accused Hamas, which rules the narrow coastal territory, of using civilian buildings as cover for fighters, commanders and weaponry, accusations it denies.
Jabalia houses families of refugees from wars with Israel dating back to 1948.
Reporting with Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says he’s “deeply alarmed” at the intensifying conflict in Gaza and escalating civilian casualties. In a statement on Tuesday he singled out "the expansion of ground operations by the Israel Defense Forces accompanied by intense air strikes, and the continued rocket fire towards Israel from Gaza". He expressed deep concern at the risk of a "dangerous escalation" beyond Gaza and called the level of aid getting into the Palestinian territory "completely inadequate". Guterres said civilians "have borne the brunt of the current fighting from the outset". He again condemned "the acts of terror perpetrated by Hamas" against Israel on October 7, and the killing of civilians in Gaza, saying he was "dismayed by reports that two-thirds of those who have been killed are women and children." He said the rules of international humanitarian law "cannot be ignored". "It is not an a la carte menu and cannot be applied selectively," he said. "All parties must abide by it, including the principles of distinction, proportionality and precaution." He reiterated his call for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire and for unimpeded humanitarian access to Gaza. AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: UN chief 'deeply alarmed' by intensifying conflict

children.content: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says he’s “deeply alarmed” at the intensifying conflict in Gaza and escalating civilian casualties.
In a statement on Tuesday he singled out "the expansion of ground operations by the Israel Defense Forces accompanied by intense air strikes, and the continued rocket fire towards Israel from Gaza".
He expressed deep concern at the risk of a "dangerous escalation" beyond Gaza and called the level of aid getting into the Palestinian territory "completely inadequate".
Guterres said civilians "have borne the brunt of the current fighting from the outset".

He again condemned "the acts of terror perpetrated by Hamas" against Israel on October 7, and the killing of civilians in Gaza, saying he was "dismayed by reports that two-thirds of those who have been killed are women and children."
He said the rules of international humanitarian law "cannot be ignored".
"It is not an a la carte menu and cannot be applied selectively," he said.
"All parties must abide by it, including the principles of distinction, proportionality and precaution."
He reiterated his call for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire and for unimpeded humanitarian access to Gaza.
AP
